For this reason, in order for the law to be clear and transparent, it is important to codify the rules that have been frequently amended.

name: Biljana Borzan (S&D)
text: Written. ‒ Montenegro has made certain steps forward in the fight against corruption, but it is necessary to ensure greater independence of the judiciary and show political will to systematically investigate, prosecute and punish corruption regardless of the political background and the position of the perpetrators.  The judiciary and prosecution are most effectively fighting corruption when given maximum autonomy and independence from political structures. I say this from the perspective of Croatia, which has shown in recent years that there are no untouchables in front of the judiciary. Eu influence and pressure has been key in this regard. Free and independent media also play a key role in the fight against corruption, as well as the democratisation of society in general.

name: Marie-Christine Boutonnet (NI)
text: In writing. I voted against this text. Indeed, the aim of the proposal is to codify certain procedures for the application of the stabilisation and association agreement between the European Union and Montenegro. The proposed new regulation would replace the various acts incorporated into it; it fully preserves the substance and merely groups it together by making the only formal modifications required by the coding operation itself. The main codified provisions provide, in particular, that fish products originating in Montenegro can be imported into the EU, within the limits of tariff quotas, at reduced tariff rates.

name: Mercedes Bresso (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour because I consider that an agreement with one of the most important Baltic countries is fundamental to strengthening the geopolitical influence of the European Union.

name: Steeve Briois (NI)
text: In writing. The purpose of the proposal is to codify Regulation (EC) 140/2008 of the Council of 19 November 2007 concerning certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other. This is also a constant codification of the previous provisions. It consists of a stabilisation and association agreement for Montenegro's future accession to the European Union. The regulation provides, for example, that fish products originating in Montenegro can be imported into the EU at reduced tariff rates.  On 29 June 2012, the European Council approved the opening of negotiations for Montenegro's accession to the Union. Because I am opposed to the very principle of the association agreement with Montenegro, I voted against this codification text which aims to prepare for Montenegro's forthcoming accession to the European Union.

name: Daniel Buda (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report on the proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other, as the country has met the political criteria for accession to the European Union, according to the latest reports of the European Commission. Montenegro continued to play a constructive role in the region and to respect its international commitments, including the conditions of the stabilisation and association process. The country's macroeconomic stability has been maintained and some progress has been made for a functioning market economy. However, Montenegro must strengthen competitiveness by improving productivity and attracting new foreign direct investment in sectors other than tourism and the real estate sector. The Republic of Montenegro has continued the alignment process throughout the reporting period and is now at varying degrees of alignment with EU law.

name: Gianluca Buonanno (NI)
text: in writing. \u2012 The text concerns the approval of a mere process of codification of texts, a formal procedure that does not introduce any change in substance, relating to a measure against which I confirm my position of opposition. I voted against the measure.

name: Alain Cadec (PPE)
text: In writing. The purpose of codification is to simplify and make EU legislation more accessible. It is a kind of compilation of different European regulations dealing with the same theme. I voted in favour of the report on the codification of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with the Republic of Montenegro.

name: Nicola Caputo (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted today in favour of the report on the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on certain procedures for implementing the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, of the other part. Considering that, according to the Advisory Group of the Legal Services of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission, the proposal in question is limited to a mere codification of the existing texts, without any substantial changes I voted in favour of this proposal and I followed the position of Parliament, which adopted its position at first reading and adopted the Commission's proposal.

name: Fabio Massimo Castaldo (EFDD)
text: in writing. \u2012 Since this is a change to the mere purpose of codifying the existing agreements, the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and the Republic of Montenegro contributes to the political and economic stability not only of the country but of all the Western Balkans, so I voted in favour.

name: Aymeric Chauprade (NI)
text: In writing. Being opposed to the very principle of this type of ultra-liberal petrol association agreement and which obliges the signatory state, as well as the Member States, in a number of areas which should continue to be part of the regal prerogatives (public policies, foreign policy, economic, political and legal system), I could only vote against this proposed regulation. The text provides for the codification of the procedures for the application of the stabilisation and association agreement between the European Community and its Member States on the one hand and Montenegro on the other. In addition, the association agreement provides, among other things, that fish products originating in Montenegro can be imported into the EU at reduced tariff rates. This is a measure that endangers our fishing industry, even though Montenegro is not a Member State and should therefore be subject to regulatory tariffs.

name: Alberto Cirio (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with the Republic of Montenegro because I see it as a further step by that country towards reforms aimed at acquiring the previous body of European legislation and towards consolidating the democratisation process. I also welcome the fact that Montenegro is currently the only country in the region to have provisionally opened and concluded some negotiating chapters with the EU, and this leading role represents an increased responsibility for me in the regional context.

name: Deirdre Clune (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ The European Union has proved that the enlargement process is still high on the agenda and this will encourage other countries of South-East Europe in their pro-reform-agenda efforts. I am glad that the EU stands behind its commitments. I hope that Montenegro will keep up with its reform processes and that the negotiations will proceed smoothly. The decision to start accession negotiations opens the door for other countries in the region to get closer to the EU. We expect that the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia will follow soon.

name: Carlos Coelho (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I support the Andrzej Duda Report on the Regulation of the European Parliament and council on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with the Republic of Montenegro which comes (by requirement of clarity and rationality), to codify Regulation (EC) No 140/2008 of 19 November 2007. The proposed new regulation will replace the various acts and fully preserve the content of the codified acts. The act in question comes on the path of the Interinstitutional Agreement of 20 December 1994 between the Commission, Council and Parliament establishing an accelerated procedure that can be used for the rapid adoption of codified acts.

name: Lara Comi (PPE)
text: in writing. Mr President, I voted in favour of the proposal for a regulation on certain procedures for implementing the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the Member States and the Republic of Montenegro, as this proposal is limited to a mere codification of existing texts, without any substantial changes.

name: Therese Comodini Cachia (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ The proposal in question contains a straightforward codification of the existing texts without any change in their substance. I have thus voted in favour of the report on codification.

name: Ignazio Corrao (EFDD)
text: in writing. \u2012 This report concerns a proposal on the codification of EU law. It is, in fact, a purely technical procedure, provided for in Article 103 of the Regulation and aimed at verifying that the codification proposal is in fact limited to mere codification, without any substantial changes. Each codification proposal is examined in advance by the legal services of the Commission, the Council and Parliament. The conclusions of this assessment are then sent to the Committee on Legal Affairs for validation and then voted on in plenary for parliament's final approval.  In view of the favourable legal opinions in this regard, I am voting in favour of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the EC and the Republic of Montenegro.

name: Miriam Dalli (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ This proposal for the codification of the act regarding the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with Montenegro fully preserves the content of said act. Due to the fact that this is a technical procedure with the contents of the regulations being preserved, I voted in favour of the report.

name: Michel Dantin (PPE)
text: In writing. This report deals with the codification within European Union law of Regulation (EC) 140/2008 concerning certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro on the other.  In particular, the regulation provides that fish products originating in Montenegro can be imported into the EU, within tariff quotas, at reduced tariff rates. I support this text, which consists of a simple exercise in codifying the positive law without any change in substance. For this reason, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Rachida Dati (PPE)
text: In writing. There is broad consensus on the text for which the European Parliament is led to give its opinion. These are certain procedures for the implementation of the stabilisation and association agreement between the European Communities and their Member States on the one hand and the Republic of Montenegro on the other. It is limited to a simple codification of existing texts, without their substance being altered in any way.

name: Mireille D'Ornano (NI)
text: In writing. I voted against this proposal, which codifies the stabilisation and association agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Montenegro. This agreement has failed to end the large underground economy in this country, where cigarette trafficking is particularly important. This trafficking is the result of an agreement between Montenegro and the European Union, in which the Balkan state agrees to break with Serbia if the Union does not be too keen on cigarette trafficking, among others. The European Union is therefore partly responsible for the proliferation of the underground economy in Montenegro.

name: Michel Dantin (PPE)
text: In writing. This report focuses on the codification within European Union law of Regulation (EC) 140/2008 concerning certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro on the other.  In particular, the regulation provides that fish products originating in Montenegro can be imported into the EU, within tariff quotas, at reduced tariff rates. I support this text as a simple exercise in codifying positive law without any change in substance. For this reason, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Ian Duncan (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ This regulation lays down procedures for the adoption of detailed rules for the implementation of certain provisions of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the EU and Montenegro, including in terms of a reduced customs duty within the tariff quota for the carriage of fish and fishery products.  The codification concerns Council Regulation (EC) No 140/2008 of 19 November 2007 on certain procedures for applying the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States and Montenegro, and for applying the Interim Agreement between the EU and Montenegro. It stipulates that fishery products originating in Montenegro may be imported into the Union at a reduced customs duty within the limits of tariff quotas.

name: Pablo Echenique (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – We voted in favour of this motion for a resolution because we consider the process of Montenegro's association with the European Union positive, as well as the language of the Resolution on human rights, capital control and regional stability.

name: Γεώργιος Επιτήδειος (
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 I voted against the report because the signing of new association agreements has been shown to exacerbate the economic crisis plaguing Europe.

name: Rosa Estaràs Ferragut (PPE)
text: in writing. The European Parliament congratulated Montenegro on its proactive participation and constructive role in regional and international cooperation, as well as in the regional reconciliation process. Accession negotiations continue on the basis of the reforms and concrete results achieved in particular with regard to the rule of law, the environment and the fight against corruption. This progress in the negotiations is accompanied by normative and institutional frameworks, and in this regard, the proposal in question contains a direct codification of the existing texts in this area The proposal fully respects the content of the codified texts and merely regroups them by making only the formal amendments that the coding operation itself requires.

name: José Inácio Faria (ALDE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I have approved the pure and simple codification of Regulation (EU) 2015/... of the European Parliament and of the Council on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, of the other part, on the opening up of fishery products originating in Montenegro which can now be imported into the Union at a reduced rate of customs duty, within the limits of tariff quotas. This is a technical diploma.

name: José Manuel Fernandes (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The report examines the proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and the Council, which codifys Council Regulation (EC) No 140/2008, on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States and the Republic of Montenegro and for the implementation of the Interim Agreement between the European Community, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, of the other part, concluding that the proposal under question is effectively based on a pure and simple codification of the existing texts, without substantive amendments. I voted in favour.

name: Edouard Ferrand (NI)
text: In writing. This text once again targets agricultural producers and fisheries products by allowing products from Montenegro, already low-cost thanks to a low-paid labour force, to benefit from reduced tariff rates.  The divide in this House is not that of the left against the right, but that of the ultra-liberals, followers of a world without borders in defiance of the peoples, against the patriots, who defend the sovereignty of states and therefore of producers.  I therefore vote against this text, which will once again weaken our producers and their families.

name: João Ferreira (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. \u2012 The purpose of this report is to codify the Regulation on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States and the Republic of Montenegro and for the implementation of the Interim Agreement between the European Community, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro. The Commission has decided to ask its services that all acts should be codified no later than 10 amendments in order to make EU legislation more accessible and easier to understand. This objective cannot be achieved as long as there is a scattering of numerous provisions, amended on several occasions, often substantially, which requires a reading of both the original act and the acts amending it. For this reason, and in order to ensure the clarity and transparency of the law, it is necessary to codify the rules which have been frequently changed.  This proposal is based on a pure and simple codification of existing texts, without substantive amendments. That is why we abstain, which does not cease to take into account the historical and political framework of this whole process (the dismemberment of Yugoslavia and the role of the EU and NATO powers in the process), already expressed on other occasions.

name: Raffaele Fitto (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The proposal concerns a simple codification of existing texts, without any substantial changes. That is why I voted in favour.

name: Monika Flašíková Beňová (S&D)
text: in writing ‒ Croatia's accession to the European Union has given a new dimension to the European Union's policy towards the Balkans. That is also why I strongly support the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council in relation to the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Montenegro. The proposal builds on the 1994 Interinstitutional Agreement and is subject to a clear and simple codification of existing existing texts without changing their substance.

name: Lorenzo Fontana (NI)
text: in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report as it is not objective and I do not share the political will behind the proposal.

name: Λάμπρος Φουντούλης (
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Voting in favour of inflated association agreements has been shown to exacerbate the economic crisis plaguing Europe. That is why I am voting against the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with the Republic of Montenegro.

name: Doru-Claudian Frunzulică (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I am in favour of the proposal as it is a straightforward codification of existing texts without any change in their substance.

name: Ildikó Gáll-Pelcz (PPE)
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted positively in favour of the proposal, which sets out the framework for relations between the European Union and the Republic of Montenegro in the future, thus enabling a common strategy to be set out. I welcome the priorities set out in this report and support the proposal, as it is in our common interest to boost the economy of the entire European area and to create prosperity. The Stabilisation and Association Agreement, outlining the vision of accession to the Union, provides an opportunity to build our policy on the basis of common standards, which will enable us to develop our economic, trade and political relations between our Member States and the Republic of Montenegro.

name: Francesc Gambús (PPE)
text: in writing. It is of particular importance to continue the process of European integration, so it is essential to support the States around us, as is the case in Montenegro. I therefore believe that this agreement is important in representing a highly positive element for the stability and prosperity of both the EU and Montenegro.

name: Enrico Gasbarra (S&D)
text: in writing. I agree with the opinions of the Legal Service of the three Eu ropean institutions on the codification of Council Regulation 140/2008 on the procedures for implementing the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the EU, its Member States and the Republic of Montenegro. This is a change to the mere purpose of codifying the aforementioned agreements, with only one formal value, but I also think it is an important political sign, which takes place on the day of the approval of the encouraging progress report on Montenegro.

name: Neena Gill (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the Duda report on the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with Montenegro, seeing that it merely concerns a codification to bring the agreement up to date, taking into account aspects modified over the past 14 years.

name: Sylvie Goddyn (NI)
text: In writing. I voted against this proposal, which codifies, without altering its substance, the stabilisation and association agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Montenegro. I note that the Union's interference in the internal affairs of this country goes so far as to give lessons to the opposition parties to focus on the process of the country's accession to the European Union. This interference is also nato's, since all EU Member States, also members of NATO, are called upon to actively support Montenegro's accession to the organisation, in order to "strengthen the stability of the region".

name: Bruno Gollnisch (NI)
text: In writing. This text on Montenegro's progress towards accession calls for some general reflections, which also apply to similar texts relating to the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia or Serbia. First, the opening of accession negotiations is increasingly in violation of the Copenhagen criteria, which set the minimum economic, legal and administrative requirements for candidates to meet. Brussels is bulimic: its power must extend to a continent whose geographical boundaries it refuses to set, let alone cultural and demographic. Secondly, membership of the European Union requires not only the substitution of European regulations for the national laws of the candidate countries, but also the abandonment of political specificities, particularly diplomatic ones, as for some of their centuries-old relations with Russia. These countries are pursuing a decoy. They sell their freedom against the lentil dish of European funds. But the European Union is increasingly a prison for peoples and nations; it is not an area of prosperity; it aspires to merge into global governance at best Americanized, at worst without a face. That is why I voted against all these texts: I cannot wish others the fate that I refuse for my own country.

name: Tania González Peñas (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this motion for a resolution because we consider the process of Montenegro's association with the European Union positive, as well as the language of the Resolution on human rights, capital control and regional stability. .

name: Theresa Griffin (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report, which concerns codification to bring the previous agreement up to date and takes into account aspects of the agreement that have been modified over the past 14 years.

name: Pablo Iglesias (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – We voted in favour of this motion for a resolution because we consider the process of Montenegro's association with the European Union positive, as well as the language of the Resolution on human rights, capital control and regional stability.

name: Ivan Jakovčić (ALDE)
text: Written. ‒ I voted for a draft legislative resolution of the European Parliament on the proposal for a regulation by Parliament and the Council on certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States and the Republic of Montenegro, as this route transfers the content of codifying acts into the proposal, bringing together only one act. Codified acts do not change in content, but are simplified and become clearer and more accessible to citizens. I also support the recommendations of advisory groups of parliament's legal services, the Council and the Commission that have contributed to make EU law more certain and transparent.

name: Jean-François Jalkh (NI)
text: In writing. Again, the European Union wants to impose its standards and political system on a third state, even though it is not a member. I voted against the adoption of this follow-up report on Montenegro, considering that the Union does not have to distribute the good and bad points, nor to interfere in the internal affairs of a sovereign state by recommending the establishment of propaganda campaigns aimed at 'changing mentalities'.

name: Marc Joulaud (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of my colleague Andrzej Duda's report on the stabilisation and association agreement with the Republic of Montenegro. In line with the effort to simplify European law, the aim here is to codify a set of existing provisions on the same subject, in order to integrate them into a single, clearer and simpler text. This report was adopted by a very large majority, which I welcome.

name: Philippe Juvin (PPE)
text: In writing. I supported this report to codify the Council's regulation on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the countries of the European Union and Montenegro. In the interests of clarity and transparency of the law, the procedure known as the formal codification of legislation allows all amendments and revisions to a text to be merged without altering its substance.

name: Afzal Khan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the report as it is simply codification to bring the agreement up to date, taking into account other aspects of the agreement modified over the past 14 years.

name: Kateřina Konečná (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. \u2012 On 11. 3. 2015, a report was discussed in the European Parliament on a proposal for a Regulation between the EP and the Council on certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the EC and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, of the other part. I abstained from voting on this codification for several reasons. First of all, the positive developments and reforms already implemented by Montenegro on its way to deeper European integration should be commended. In my opinion, Montenegro is on very good track to become a full member of the EU in the near future. On the other hand, the Stabilisation and Association Agreement itself with Montenegro contains several problematic provisions that I cannot identify with. Among them is the call and support for Montenegro's integration into NATO. As I have said several times, I insist that the EU has no right to dictate to anyone in any way to join the international military organisation, which NATO is above all. In the context of what is happening in Ukraine, this approach by the European institutions appears to be pernicious, crude, highly unreasonable and denies the fundamental attribute of state sovereignty to choose freely the way in which it defends its own. Therefore, in view of these contradictions, I have decided to abstain from voting.

name: Giovanni La Via (PPE)
text: in writing. I am voting in favour of Andrzej Duda's report because its aim is to start codifying procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other. The rapporteur's proposal, which is of a technical nature, codifies the existing texts, without making any substantial changes.

name: Marine Le Pen (NI)
text: In writing. I voted against this report, which proposes to accept the codification of the developments of a text that is part of the Union's neighbourhood and integration policy, a questionable and ill-developed strategy. The strengthening of the regulatory framework, including tariff concessions in the fisheries sector, is also not acceptable without regular and in-depth monitoring of the economic implications of the agreement.

name: Gilles Lebreton (NI)
text: In writing. I voted against this agreement because it paves the way for Montenegro's future accession to the European Union. Montenegro is in a catastrophic economic and social situation and will be a burden for us. I am, in any case, hostile in principle to any further membership of the Union.

name: Philippe Loiseau (NI)
text: In writing. Vote against. The European Union continues to prepare its enlargement to other countries. The economic situation of the Member States is delicate and it seems perilous to prepare for the accession of other countries. This is reflected in the obligation to respect dogmas to which Montenegro is obliged to adhere, ranging from the diplomatic decisions of the European Union to the promotion of sexual diversity. It should be noted that some of the country's economic sectors receive funding from the European Union. This is the case for its agricultural sector, which is concerned that products, as well as those of other accession countries that receive the same funding, will compete with our productions. The precise case of fish products in this matter, with the plan to facilitate their importation into the European Union, is a worrying provision.

name: Paloma López Bermejo (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the report since its purpose was merely to codify and transpose to the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with Montenegro (in force since 2010) the legislative updates made since then affecting the implementation of the Treaty.

name: Antonio López-Istúriz White (PPE)
text: in writing. Since the proposed amendments do not constitute a material alteration of the matter in the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other hand, I accept and approve the proposal for this version which includes the recommendations of the Legal Services of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission.

name: Andrejs Mamikins (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 Montenegro managed to pass through the Yugoslav crisis without wars and bloodshed. The early integration of Melkalne will help this European country to stabilise and flourish in the middle of the European continent. I voted in favour.

name: Νότης Μαριάς (ECR)
text: Writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report on the proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other, because Article 2 of the Regulation to be adopted lays down concessions for fish and fishery products which is going to cause enormous economic damage to the Greek fishermen poor by the Memorandum.

name: Dominique Martin (NI)
text: In writing. Dominique Martin voted against the stabilization agreement. This agreement aims to codify certain procedures for the future accession of the Republic of Montenegro to the European Union, the next step in the UNION's obsession with integration.

name: David Martin (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for this report as the proposal in question contains a straightforward codification of the existing texts without any change in their substance.

name: Fulvio Martusciello (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I support the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on procedures for implementing the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States on the one hand and the Republic of Montenegro on the other. Although there are no substantial changes, it may be useful to codify what exists with the aim of better outlining important points, since opening up the EU to relations with Balkan countries such as Montenegro is an important point for the economy, the market, and products. A stimulus for the development of production capacities can also help the country to improve and establish an industrial sector.

name: Barbara Matera (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The purpose of the Duda report is to ensure that the codification of certain procedures for implementing the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other, is initiated.  Since my colleague's proposal is limited to a mere codification of the existing texts, without making the same substantive changes, I have chosen to support it with my vote in favour.

name: Georg Mayer (NI)
text: Writing. I abstained from voting on the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with Montenegro, as Montenegro's rapprochement with the European Union is seen as a further provocation to Russia. The enormous costs that the Union has to cover, while at the same time providing little benefit, can be seen in the example of Moldova.

name: Jean-Luc Mélenchon (GUE/NGL)
text: In writing. Codification consists of grouping normative texts of various natures into collections concerning a given subject with the aim of simplification, clarity and transparency. The purpose of this proposal is to codify The Council Regulation (EC) 140/2008 of 19 November 2007 concerning certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro on the other.  It should be remembered that association agreements aim to impose free trade with the countries concerned. These undemocratic technocratic procedures prevent Europe from practising solidarity protectionism, which is the ecological and social emergency of our time. Also, even if it is only a technical report, I vote against it.

name: Nuno Melo (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 We deal here only with a technical issue.  The aim of this proposal is to codify Council Regulation (EC) No 140/2008 of 19 November 2007 on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, of the other part, and the implementation of the Interim Agreement between the European Community and the Republic of Montenegro. The new Regulation will replace the various acts contained therein.  Hence my vote in favour.

name: Roberta Metsola (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report regarding the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with the Republic of Montenegro because the consultative working party of the legal services of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission concluded that the proposed codification of the existing texts is straightforward and presents no change in their substance. It is crucial that agreements that have been amended many times be codified in order to ensure that they are accessible and clear to citizens.

name: Louis Michel (ALDE)
text: In writing. I agree with the adoption of this text to codify Regulation 140/2008 on certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Union and Montenegro. This codification is representative of the efforts made by the European Parliament to improve the clarity and transparency of the law for citizens.

name: Marlene Mizzi (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I am in favour of the report for a proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on certain procedures for applying the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro.

name: Csaba Molnár (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 The proposal submitted is to unify the Association Agreement with Montenegro and an older Council Regulation without any substantive amendments.

name: Cláudia Monteiro de Aguiar (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 This report focuses on the goal of codifying legislative documents, i.e. simplifying Union legislation, with only technical and non-content changes. For the reasons set out above, I voted in favour of this technical amendment which has not changed the content of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with the Republic of Montenegro.

name: Sophie Montel (NI)
text: In writing. The purpose of the proposal is to codify Regulation (EC) 140/2008 of the Council of 19 November 2007 concerning certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro on the other. This is also a constant codification of the previous provisions. It consists of a stabilisation and association agreement for Montenegro's future accession to the European Union.  On 29 June 2012, the European Council approved the opening of negotiations for Montenegro's accession to the European Union.  The infinite enlargement of the Union is scandalous, and even though it is only a measure of transparency, I have decided to vote against this text.

name: Claude Moraes (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report, which will help to bring the agreement up to dat and take into account other aspects modified over the past 14 years, such as anti-dumping and excessive imports.

name: Nadine Morano (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text on the codification of the Council regulation on certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro on the other.  This regulation has been amended several times and substantially, so that its provisions are now found for one part in the original act and for the rest scattered in the amending acts that followed.  In the interests of clarity and simplification of the law, guaranteeing greater legal certainty and better information for citizens, it was therefore necessary to codify this regulation. This process completely preserves its substance and merely brings together in a legible way the various changes that have been made to it.

name: Alessia Maria Mosca (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 We welcome this proposal for a regulation on certain procedures for implementing the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other, since it is limited to a mere codification of the existing texts, without therefore containing any substantial changes to the original agreement.

name: Renaud Muselier (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report because the proposal in question is limited to an outright codification of the existing texts, without altering their substance.

name: Alessandra Mussolini (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Union attaches great importance to the simplification and clear formulation of Community legislation, so that it becomes more comprehensible and accessible to citizens. This objective cannot be achieved as long as the countless provisions, amended on several occasions and often substantially, remain scattered, forcing those who wish to consult them to seek them both in the original act and in the acts of amendment. The purpose of this proposal is, therefore, to that of initiating the codification of Council Regulation (EC) No 140/2008 of 19 November 2007 on certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, of the other part, and of the Interim Agreement between the European Community, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, of the other part, without making any substantial changes. In the light of the above, I am voting in favour of the proposal by the rapporteur, Mr Duda, because I believe it is essential to codify the provisions that have been frequently amended if Community legislation is to be clear and transparent.

name: Victor Negrescu (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted for this report because the rules laid down in its text lay down the procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other.

name: Liadh Ní Riada (GUE/NGL)
text: scríofa. ‒ Bhí an vóta seo bainteach le códaíocht agus is ionann sin agus simpliú i ndáiríre. Toisc go bhfuil sé teicniúil agus bainteach leis an simpliú in áit an ábharthacht chaith mé vóta i bhfabhar.

name: Norica Nicolai (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this agreement, as I believe that we have to make more of an effort to bring the Western Balkans closer to the European Union. Montenegro is a country which has made a lot of efforts for reform and which deserves an increase in both trade and political ties with the EU, in anticipation of an ever closer relationship.

name: Franz Obermayr (NI)
text: Writing. The proposal provides impetus for the stability of the region. At the same time, however, I also see the danger that this will once again take a step towards the enlargement of the EU, contrary to the express will of the majority of our citizens. That is why I abstained.

name: Urmas Paet (ALDE)
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the proposal because it contributes to Montenegro's approach to the EU.

name: Aldo Patriciello (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 According to the Advisory Group of the Legal Services of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission, the proposal in question is limited to a mere codification of existing texts, without any substantial changes. For these reasons, I voted in favour.

name: Florian Philippot (NI)
text: In writing. The purpose of the proposal is to codify Regulation (EC) 140/2008 of the Council of 19 November 2007 concerning certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro on the other. This is also a constant codification of the previous provisions. It consists of a stabilisation and association agreement for Montenegro's future accession to the European Union.  On 29 June 2012, the European Council approved the opening of negotiations for Montenegro's accession to the Union.  The infinite enlargement of the EU is scandalous, and even though it is only a measure of transparency, I have decided to vote against this text.

name: Tonino Picula (S&D)
text: Written. ‒I support colleague Duda's report, as, according to the Advisory Group on the Legal Services of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission, the proposal in question is limited only to codifying existing texts without substantive changes.

name: Andrej Plenković (PPE)
text: Written. ‒ I support MEP Andrzej Duda's report on the proposal for a regulation by the European Parliament and the Council on certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other hand, and for the application of the Interim Agreement between the European Community, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other hand, since the advisory group of legal services of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission has agreed that the proposal is indeed limited only to codifying existing texts without substantive changes. The purpose of the proposal is to codify Council Regulation (EC) No 2020/2013. 140/2008 since 19 November 2007, which has changed several times.  Codification of acts, which are often changed, is essential in simplifying and explaining EUROPEAN Union law to make it clearer and more accessible to citizens and to give citizens the opportunity and opportunity to exercise their special rights it has been given to them. Codification also ensures certainty as to the law applicable to a particular case at a given time. I welcome the continued efforts of parliament's professional services, the Council and the Commission in codification procedures.

name: Salvatore Domenico Pogliese (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on measures implementing the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Economic Community and the Republic of Montenegro because, according to the opinion issued on 17/9/2014 by the Consultative Group of legal services of the EP, EC, and Council, the proposal for a regulation is simply a codification of the existing texts, without any major changes.

name: Jiří Pospíšil (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I support montenegro's progress report on its path to European integration. I consider European cooperation with Montenegro, as a country neighbouring eu members, to be very important. I consider the report to be balanced because it mentions the achievements and problems on the road to the country's European future. Among the achievements is the fact that Montenegro is now the only country in the region capable of closing individual chapters in the negotiations. On the other hand, there is no need to close our eyes to other necessary steps, such as the rule of law, the judiciary or the fight against corruption. This position is contained in the report and therefore deserves support.

name: Franck Proust (PPE)
text: In writing. The EU has concluded several stabilization and association agreements with several Balkan states, including Montenegro. These agreements are part of a rapprochement perspective, rather than enlargement.  The European Parliament expressed its support for the text on the procedures for implementing the agreement between the EU and Montenegro. I myself voted in favour of this proposal. However, I reaffirm my wish to establish a five- to ten-year moratorium on any new membership.

name: Paulo Rangel (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 At its meeting on 10 July 2014, the Advisory Group composed of the Legal Services of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission reviewed the proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and the Council, regulation (EEC) No 140/2008 of the Council of 19 November 2007 on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States and the Republic of Montenegro and for the implementation of the Interim Agreement between the European Community, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other. It then concluded, by common agreement, that the proposal under question should be based on a pure and simple codification of the existing texts, without substantive amendments. I voted, therefore, in favor.

name: Sofia Ribeiro (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because it only corrects and codifies the existing texts, not leading to substantive changes.

name: Liliana Rodrigues (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 Since the Advisory Group on the Legal Services of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission has delivered a positive opinion and considers that this proposal is limited to the pure and simple codification of existing texts, without substantive amendments to the texts, there is no reason to vote against or even to abstain.

name: Inmaculada Rodríguez-Piñero Fernández (S&D)
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this draft resolution because, as indicated by the Legal Services Advisory Group of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission, the proposal is limited to a simple codification of existing acts, without substantial changes, concerning the procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and its Member States , on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other hand, and the application of the Interim Agreement between the European Community, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other.

name: Claude Rolin (PPE)
text: In writing. We adopted this report yesterday which encourages the continuation of accession negotiations on the basis of the reforms implemented and concrete results, "particularly in the areas of the rule of law, the media environment and the fight against corruption". This is an opportunity to remind us, once again, how much reforms related to the rule of law are at the heart of the integration process. The text of the resolution stated that "political will remains crucial to making lasting progress in the fight against corruption and organised crime, the main indicator of the independence, efficiency and professionalism of the judicial system". Not to mention the progress in reforming public administration, freedom of expression and the media, and the lasting economic reforms that remain necessary... Finally, we underlined our concern about the deep polarisation of the country, which results in a partial boycott of the main opposition party and, therefore, called on all political forces to focus on the country's accession process to the European Union and to establish a lasting dialogue and constructive cooperation.

name: Fernando Ruas (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 This proposal concerns the codification of Council Regulation (EEC) No 140/2008 of 19 November 2007 on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States and the Republic of Montenegro and for the implementation of the Interim Agreement between the European Community, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other. It is based on the Interinstitutional Agreement of 20/121994, which introduces an accelerated working method on the official codification of legislative texts.  It is essentially a question of unifying, in a cohesive manner, the system on safeguard measures contained in this Agreement, which is subject to the rules of codecision. For all the above, it deserves my vote in favour.

name: Tokia Saïfi (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report, which deals with the proposed regulation on certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation And Association Agreement with the Republic of Montenegro. It was necessary to approve the Commission's proposal, which echoed the recommendations of the European Parliament's Legal Services Advisory Group, the Council and the Commission. This proposal is thus limited to an outright codification of existing texts, without altering their substance.

name: Matteo Salvini (NI)
text: in writing. I have chosen to vote against it because it is a mere process of 'codifying' texts, a formal procedure that does not introduce any change in substance, relating to a measure against which we confirm our position of opposition.

name: Lola Sánchez Caldentey (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – We voted in favour of this motion for a resolution because we consider the process of Montenegro's association with the European Union positive, as well as the language of the Resolution on human rights, capital control and regional stability.

name: Anne Sander (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this purely technical report, which is limited to codifying existing acts, without altering their substance.

name: Jean-Luc Schaffhauser (NI)
text: In writing. This proposal aims to codify Regulation (EC) 140/2008 on the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Union and Montenegro, and to clarify its conditions for implementation. In particular, the agreement provides that fish products originating in Montenegro can be imported into the EU, within tariff quotas, at reduced tariff rates.  I am opposed to this text because I do not want to see additional unfair competition on our fishermen because of the Union, which is also coming from a country that is not ready for membership.

name: Lidia Senra Rodríguez (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. I abstained since, although it is noted that its purpose was merely to codify and transpose to the Agreement on Stabilisation and Association with Montenegro (in force since 2010) legislative updates since then affecting the implementation of the Treaty, I am not sure that it has no other impacts.

name: Siôn Simon (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report on the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with Montenegro. I welcome the codification to bring the agreement up to date, taking into account other aspects of the agreement modified over the past 14 years: Union tariff quotas for high—quality beef, and for pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and maslin, and brans, sharps and other residues.

name: Igor Šoltes (Verts/ALE)
text: Writing. \ I believe that the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with Montenegro is important for good trade relations between the European Union and Montenegro. This agreement has a positive impact on the economic situation in the country and also promotes and strengthens cooperation between Montenegro and the EU. In any case, the agreement is important for further negotiations with Montenegro's accession to the EU. For this reason, I voted in favour of the report.

name: Davor Ivo Stier (PPE)
text: Written. ‒Taking into account the Council decision (14187/2013) and the Stabilisation and Association Agreement Protocol between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, and the request for consent submitted by the Council in accordance with Article 217, in relation to Article 218, paragraph 6 of the second subdia, paragraphs a and Article 218, paragraph 8, the second sub-paragraph of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (C7-0007/2014) and the proposal of the Committee on Foreign Affairs (A7-0192/2014), I support the Stabilisation and Association Agreement.

name: Catherine Stihler (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report, which will codify and bring up to date modifications made to the agreement between the EU and the Republic of Montenegro over the past 14 years.

name: Dubravka Šuica (PPE)
text: Written. - The purpose of this report is to codify the aforementioned Council and Parliament regulation without substantive changes. In 1992, the Presidency of the European Council in Edinburgh confirmed the codification of all procedures after more than ten amendments, underlining their importance. The new proposal for a regulation fully preserves the unique content of the acts. The main codified provisions contain a proposal stipulating certain procedures for the adoption of detailed rules for the implementation of the provisions of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other. It is stipulated that fish products originating in Montenegro may be imported into the European Union at reduced customs, within the limits of tariff quotas. Provisions regulating the management of those tariff quotas should therefore be laid down. In particular, the proposal lays down concessions for fish, fish products and certain tariff reductions and lays down conditions concerning the safeguard clause for agricultural and fish products. I believe that these measures should be adopted in accordance with the regulation of the European Parliament and the Council, and the Commission must adopt the applicable acts immediately.

name: Ελευθέριος Συναδινός (
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Voting in favour of inflated association agreements has been shown to exacerbate the economic crisis plaguing Europe.

name: Marc Tarabella (S&D)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the european Parliament and the Council's proposed regulation on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other, and trusted the experts in my political group on this matter.

name: Mylène Troszczynski (NI)
text: In writing. Once again, a report that requires Montenegro to adopt a regime and political system dictated by the European Union, which poses as a schoolteacher who would distribute the good and bad points. European parliamentarians are dictating to the Parliament of Montenegro how they should conduct their political and legislative work! We are AGAINST this odious interference in the national affairs of other sovereign states.

name: Traian Ungureanu (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Commission, with the right to initiate and propose legislative drafts, has always assumed and has always supported the need for simple and clear legislation so that any European citizen can understand the legislative act and make use of the specific rights conferred on him through it. Clarification of European legislative acts is done through a legislative procedure called codification of legislative acts. With a view to the rapid adoption of codified acts, the European institutions agreed in 1994 to use an accelerated procedure. The legislative proposal which was the subject of the European Parliament's report concerns the codification of Regulation (EC) No 1493/1999. Council Regulation (EC) No 140/2008 of 19 November 2007 on certain procedures for the application of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, of the other part, and the application of the Interim Agreement between the European Community, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, of the other part. Given that the codification proposal retains the full content of the codified acts and merely regroups them, making only the formal changes required by the coding operation itself, the European Parliament, by unanimous vote granted, supports the proposal for codification of the Regulation.

name: Miguel Urbán Crespo (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. We voted against this report, presented by Pablo Zalba by the ECON Commission, on the report presented by the Competition Commissioner. The Resolution assumes the basic postulates of a liberal conception that promotes the free movement of capital and services, all within the framework of TTE.

name: Ernest Urtasun (Verts/ALE)
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the evaluation report on Montenegro's eu accession process. It should be remembered that he has been a candidate since 2010 and negotiations began in 2012.

name: Ángela Vallina (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the report since its purpose was merely to codify and transpose to the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with Montenegro (in force since 2010) the legislative updates made since then affecting the implementation of the Treaty.

name: Hilde Vautmans (ALDE)
text: Written. \u2012 Of all the progress reports from the Balkan countries discussed during this part-session, the evolution in Montenegro in 2014 is the most problematic. The country severely violates the freedom of the press (Montenegro ranks 114th in terms of freedom of the press in 180), corruption is rampant and an objective and impartial government is largely absent. If this country ever becomes a member of the EU, it will be due to the pressure that the European Commission is putting on the necessary reforms.

name: Miguel Viegas (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. \u2012 The purpose of this report is the codification of Council Regulation (EC) No 140/2008 of 19 November 2007 on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States and the Republic of Montenegro and for the implementation of the Interim Agreement between the European Community, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro, on the other. Since 1987, all acts should be codified no later than 10 amendments in order to make EU legislation more accessible and easier for ordinary citizens to understand. In order to ensure the clarity and transparency of the law, it is necessary to codify the rules which have been frequently changed. This cannot be achieved as long as there is a scattering of numerous provisions, amended on several occasions.  This proposal is based on a pure and simple codification of existing texts, without substantive amendments.

name: Harald Vilimsky (NI)
text: Writing. I abstained from voting because, if Montenegro were to move closer together, the Union would have to cover enormous costs and at the same time little benefit, but the country is still part of the European family of states.

name: Beatrix von Storch (ECR)
text: Writing. I voted against these proposals because they clearly point to Montenegro's timely membership of the EU. In its European election manifesto, however, the AfD has positioned itself against EU enlargement and deepening. Those who are in favour of The Stabilisation and Association Agreements (SAA) are in fact involved in the preparation of this EU enlargement.

name: Inês Cristina Zuber (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. \u2012 The purpose of this Report is the codification of Council Regulation (EC) No 140/2008 of 19 November 2007 on certain procedures for the implementation of the Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States and the Republic of Montenegro and for the implementation of the Interim Agreement between the European Community, of the one part, and the Republic of Montenegro. This proposal is based on a pure and simple codification of existing texts, without substantive amendments. However, it is important to stress that the Association and Stabilisation Agreement with the Republic of Montenegro requires the amendment of its labour legislation, electoral law, the end of sovereign mechanisms for the protection of the economy and productive activity, destroying SMEs and small and medium-sized farmers, the realization of privatizations, neoliberal measures that are contrary to the interests of montenegrins.

name: Marina Albiol Guzmán (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this report because this is a pure and simple technical question of the codification of existing acts without substantial changes. This legal amendment adjusts existing legislation without any impact on current legislation. It is because this is a technical issue which will have no major impact on producers and producers and I have decided to vote in favour of this report.

name: Νίκος Ανδρουλάκης (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 This proposal is a simple codification of existing texts, without any substantive amendment, and I am voting in favour of its adoption.

name: Pascal Arimont (PPE)
text: Writing. This is a mere codification without any change in the content of the legislation in question, and that is why I voted in favour of this proposal.

name: Marie-Christine Arnautu (NI)
text: In writing. The codification of developments in the EU tariff quota regulation for high-quality beef, pork, poultry meat, wheat and meteil and sounds, remising and other residues is part of the strengthening of the regulatory framework that opens the European market to foreign products and is one of the elements of the passivity of the UNION's trade policy. Excessive importation of foodstuffs such as meat is hurting the activity of European producers when it should be protected, especially at a time of economic crisis. So I voted against this report.

name: Jonathan Arnott (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this resolution because, as a UKIP MEP, I believe that the United Kingdom should be in charge of all issues relating to trade tariffs.

name: Jean Arthuis (ALDE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this deliberation because it is limited to an outright codification of the existing texts, without altering their substance.

name: Zigmantas Balčytis (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this proposal for Union tariff quotas for high-quality beef, as well as for pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and meslin and bran, sharps and other residues. The purpose of the proposal is to codify existing texts without changing their substance.

name: Nicolas Bay (NI)
text: In writing. I voted against this report, which promotes the importation of food into the European Union. This obviously goes against the interests of European farmers, and in particular French farmers, whose dramatic situation concerns me more than ever.

name: Hugues Bayet (S&D)
text: In writing. The purpose of this is the codification of the 29 March 1994 regulation on the opening and management of certain Community tariff quotas for high-quality beef, swine meat, poultry meat, wheat and meteil and sounds, remoulding and other residues.

name: Dominique Bilde (NI)
text: In writing. The purpose of this report is to codify the Council's Regulation (EC) 774/94 of 29 March 1994, opening and managing certain Community tariff quotas for high-quality beef, swine meat, poultry meat, wheat and meteil and sounds, swirls and other residues. This codified regulation, by opening tariff quotas, facilitates the importation into the European Union of the aforementioned products. If this text is merely a codification without substantive change, I oppose this European desire for free trade and the abolition of all tariffs. That is why I voted against this report.

name: Mara Bizzotto (NI)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted against the text which, although it does not introduce any change in substance, is a measure against which I would like to confirm my firm opposition on this occasion too.

name: José Blanco López (S&D)
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council, as indicated by the Legal Services Advisory Group of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission, with a view to the codification of Council Regulation (EC) No 774/94, 29 March 1994, concerning the opening and management of certain Community tariff quotas for higher quality beef, pork, poultry meat, wheat, tranquillon, bran, moyuelos and other waste, is limited to a simple codification of existing acts, without substantial modification.

name: Vilija Blinkevičiūtė (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted on this report, which supports the proposal for codification of the opinion of 29 March 1994. Council Regulation (EC) No 774/94 on high-quality beef, as well as for the administration of quotas for pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and meslin and bran. This Council Regulation provides for certain Community tariff quotas for high-quality beef, as well as for pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and meslin and bran, sharps and other residues, and provides for the administration of such quotas. The new regulation will replace the various acts whose provisions have been incorporated into it; This proposal does not alter the content of the codification legislation, as it merely consolidates these acts by making changes to the form necessary for codification.

name: Biljana Borzan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒I support the proposal for a regulation by the Commission, the European Parliament and the Council on the opening of certain Union tariff quotas for high-quality beef, pigmeat, poultry meat, wheat and sows and other residues, and on the management of those quotas.  The proposal has been adapted according to the recommendations of the Advisory Group of legal services of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission and is limited only to codifying existing texts without substantive changes.

name: Marie-Christine Boutonnet (NI)
text: In writing. I voted against this proposal for a regulation on EU tariff quotas for high-quality beef, pork, poultry meat, wheat (wheat) and meteil and sounds, remoulages and other residues. On the one hand, trade policy must remain an exclusive competence of the Member States. On the other hand, I am against the granting of tariff quotas by the European Union to third countries. These facilitate imports that compete with our different sectors. We need to protect our agriculture.

name: Mercedes Bresso (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour because I consider it very important to establish Union tariff quotas for the products concerned.

name: Steeve Briois (NI)
text: In writing. The purpose of the proposal is the constant-law codification of Regulation (EC) 774/94 of the Council of 29 March 1994 on the opening and management of certain Community tariff quotas for high-quality beef, swine meat, poultry meat, wheat and meteil and sounds, re-mouldings and other residues.  It is a measure of simplification, clarification of EU law and improvement of the accessibility of the law.  This codification follows the conclusion of an agreement on concessions and tariff quotas on the basis of Article 31 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union on certain specific products.  At a time when the beef sector is facing serious structural difficulties - linked to the excesses of the CAP - and cyclical ones - as a result of the Russian embargo, any text that aims to recognise or facilitate the importation of certain quantities of agricultural products is a real nod to our farmers and farmers. That is why I voted against this text.

name: Daniel Buda (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the coded text report on the proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on the opening and management of certain Union tariff quotas for high-quality beef, pork, poultry, wheat, borceag and bran, breezes and other residues, as this coding procedure seeks to achieve greater clarity and simplicity of the reports , without altering them in substance.  The purpose of this proposal is to codify the Council Regulation of 29 March 1994 on the opening and management of certain Community tariff quotas for high-quality beef and for pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and borceag and bran, cracks and other residues, and to substitute it for the various acts incorporated into it. Moreover, it retains the entire content of the acts thus codified and therefore merely makes the formal changes required by the coding operation itself.

name: Gianluca Buonanno (NI)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted against. The proposal concerns the adoption of a mere process of codification of the texts relating to a measure against which I confirm my opposition.

name: Alain Cadec (PPE)
text: In writing. One of the wishes of European legislators is to make EU legislation simpler and more accessible so that it can be implemented as best as possible. Codification is an element that can achieve this goal.  I voted in favour of this report, which deals with the codification of tariff quotas for high-quality beef, pork, poultry meat, wheat (wheat) and meteil and sounds, remoulages and other residues.

name: Nicola Caputo (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted today in favour of the European Parliament resolution on the need to codify Regulation (EC) No 774/94 of 29 March 1994 on the management of certain Community tariff quotas for high-quality beef, pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and rye wheat and bran, stails and other residues under international agreements. In order to successfully implement the Lisbon Strategy, it is essential to simplify and clarify the regulatory environment of the European Union, especially for those provisions that guarantee the nature, provenance and origin of products, so as to make it simpler and more stable. Ensuring legal certainty applicable to a given subject at a specific time is an objective that cannot be achieved as long as the regulatory provisions are amended several times. Simplification requires not only a common method, but also a common spirit. All the institutions and the Member States must therefore make the necessary effort to simplify the regulatory environment

name: Matt Carthy (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report as its implementation will provide for greater legal certainty and clarity. This report primarily relates to codification of legal texts. This is important as, if a text is not codified, previously amended versions of it remain valid. Codification is - in a nutshell - simplification.   Any proposal that provides greater legal clarity and transparency should be welcomed as it is the complex nature of such texts which frequently leads to unnecessary legal challenges, often at taxpayers' expense.

name: Fabio Massimo Castaldo (EFDD)
text: in writing. \u2012 The adoption of Mr Andrzej Duda's report is only intended to formally codify Council Regulation (EC) No 774/94 of 29 March 1994 opening and operating certain Union tariff quotas for high-quality beef, pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and rye wheat and bran, slings and other residues. Consequently, it does not contain any substantial changes to the original agreement.

name: Aymeric Chauprade (NI)
text: In writing. I voted against this report because it is about promoting the importation of food into the European Union. This is nonsense when we know that in 2014, according to INSEE, plant production brought in 201,025 million euros and animal production 168,047 million euros. The European Union is therefore self-sufficient in its agricultural production and facilitating imports would only weaken our industries and our farmers. A proposal which therefore follows an ultraliberal dogma rather than pursuing the interest of the peoples in Europe.

name: Salvatore Cicu (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The fact that Regulation (EC) No 77/94 of 29 March 1994, which lays down the detailed rules for European Union tariffs relating to high-quality beef, pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat, bran and rye wheat, is merely a codification procedure without changing the text, I have decided to vote in favour of the measure

name: Alberto Cirio (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I think it would be very useful to codify Regulation (EC) No 774/94 of 29 March 1994 opening and operating certain Union tariff quotas for high-quality beef, pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and rye wheat and bran, sawning and other residues. As this is a purely technical issue linked to the codification of the existing 1994 text, without any substantial changes, I voted in favour.

name: Lara Comi (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the proposal for a regulation opening and operating certain Union tariff quotas and certain types of meat and wheat, as examined by the Advisory Group, this proposal is limited to a mere codification of existing texts without significant changes.

name: Therese Comodini Cachia (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ The proposal in question contains a straightforward codification of the existing texts without any change in their substance. I thus voted in favour of the report on codification.

name: Ignazio Corrao (EFDD)
text: in writing. \u2012 This report concerns a proposal on the codification of EU law. It is, in fact, a purely technical procedure, provided for in Article 103 of the Regulation and aimed at verifying that the codification proposal is in fact limited to mere codification, without any substantial changes. Each codification proposal is examined in advance by the legal services of the Commission, the Council and Parliament. The conclusions of this assessment are then sent to the Committee on Legal Affairs for validation and then voted on in plenary for parliament's final approval.  In view of the favourable legal opinions on this matter, I am voting in favour of the Union tariff quotas for high-quality beef, pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and rye and bran, hem and other residues.

name: Miriam Dalli (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ This proposal for the codification of the act regarding EU tariff quotas for high-quality beef, and for pig meat, poultry meat, wheat and brans, fully preserves the content of said act. Due to the fact that this is a technical procedure with the contents of the regulations being preserved, I voted in favour of the report.

name: Rachida Dati (PPE)
text: In writing. The proposed new regulation on how certain EU tariff quotas for high-quality beef, swine meat, poultry meat, wheat and meteil and sounds, remistling and other residues are managed - should only replace the various acts incorporated into them. It is limited to a simple codification of existing texts, and it remains faithful to the content of the grouped texts. I therefore voted in favour of this report.

name: Mireille D'Ornano (NI)
text: In writing. The codification of developments in the EU tariff quota regulation for high-quality beef, pork, poultry meat, wheat and meteil and sounds, remising and other residues is part of the strengthening of the regulatory framework that opens the European market to foreign products and is one of the elements of the passivity of the UNION's trade policy. Excessive importation of foodstuffs such as meat is hurting the activity of European producers, which must be protected, especially in times of crisis. So I voted against it.

name: Michel Dantin (PPE)
text: In writing. This report focuses on the codification within EU law of Regulation 774/94 on the opening and management of certain EU tariff quotas for high-quality beef, swine meat, poultry meat, wheat and meteil and sounds, swirls and other residues. I support this text as a simple exercise in codifying positive law without any change in substance. For this reason, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Ian Duncan (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ The report supports codification of Council Regulation (EC) No 774/94 of 29 March 1994 on opening and providing for the administration of certain Community tariff quotas for high-quality beef, and for pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and meslin, and brans, sharps and other residues. The EU negotiated tariff concessions under Article XXVIII of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) and under the Uruguay Round of multilateral trade negotiations. The negotiations led to agreements which provide for the opening, under certain conditions, of certain annual Community tariff quotas for high-quality beef, and for pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and meslin, and brans, sharps and other residues. It opens annual Community tariff quotas for high-quality beef, and for pigmeat, poultrymeat, wheat and meslin, and brans, sharps and other residues.

name: Γεώργιος Επιτήδειος (
